question: Posted By Eric on June 03, 1998 at 12:50:51:I am a 27 yr. old male, and I have been suffering for 6 consecutive weeks with the same symptoms.  With no prior history of stomach problems, I developed extreme fullness, bloating, and discomfort after eating about 6 weeks ago.  Along with that, I've been experiencing a constant state of nausea and quesyness with discomfort(not burning) right below my rib cage.  I've also experienced severe fatigue and light headedness.  Because it has become so difficult to eat, I've lost 14 lbs. in 3 weeks(I was at the ideal wait for my age and height).I was hospitilized for a week and underwent several tests including:  Endoscopy, sygmoidoscopy(sp), Upper and Lower GI w/barium, CT Scan, Gastric Emptying test, Gall-bladder test, ultrasound, and blood work.  All have come back negative.My physician is treating the symptoms as Acid-reflux with Zantac, Sucralfate, and regalan.  However, I haven't been, and never did experience any of the "classic" symptoms of acid reflux.I have been under some stress, but most of it has come from this sudden illness.  There is a history of diabetes in my family including my brother and mother.  Also, I own a cat who has frequently been sick with undiagnosed vomiting.Should I be tested for diabetes?  Should I be tested for any animal transmitted parasites?  Can depression cause such long-term symptoms?I appreciate your time and concern.Eric
title: Undiagnosed Stomach Problem
